User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the ClickSync application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user (matches auth.uid).

Counter.title: Counter
Counter.description: Represents a counter value associated with a single user.

value.description: The current value of the counter.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the last update.

definition.description: Stores public user profile data. The document ID must match the user's Firebase Auth UID.
Stores a private counter for each user. Access is restricted by security rules to the user whose UID matches {userId}.

firestore.reasoning: The data is structured around users. A top-level 'users' collection holds all user-related data. Each user has a document ID matching their Firebase Authentication UID. Sub-collections within each user's document, like 'counters', store data that is private to that user. This path-based ownership model makes writing secure and efficient Firestore security rules straightforward, as rules can simply check if the requesting user's UID matches the {userId} in the document path.
